the definitions found in the city plumbing code for backflow crossconnections and backflow prevention devices shall be those used in this article in addition the following definitions shall apply air gap means a physical separation sufficient to prevent backflow between the freeflowing discharge end of the potable water system and any other system physically defined as a distance equal to twice the diameter of the supply side pipe diameter but never less than one inch approved means accepted by the director of public works as meeting an applicable specification stated or cited in this regulation or as suitable for the proposed use auxiliary water supply means any water supply on or available to the premises other than the citys approved public water supply these auxiliary waters may include water from another purveyors public potable water supply or any natural sources such as a well spring river stream harbor etc or used waters or industrial fluids these waters may be contaminated or polluted or they may be objectionable and constitute an unacceptable water source over which the city does not have sanitary control backflow means the flow of water or other liquids mixtures or substances under positive or reduced pressure in the distribution pipes of a potable water supply from any source other than its intended source backflow preventer means a device or means designed to prevent backflow or backsiphonage most commonly categorized as air gap reduced pressure principal assembly doublecheck valve assembly pressure vacuum breaker atmospheric vacuum breaker hose bibb vacuum breaker residential dual check and barometric loop containment means a method of backflow prevention which requires a backflow preventer at the water service entrance contaminant means a substance that will impair the quality of the water to a degree that it creates a serious health hazard to the public leading to poisoning or the spread of disease contamination means an impairment of the quality of the potable water by sewage industrial fluids or waste liquids compounds or other materials to a degree which creates an actual or potential hazard to the public health or spread of disease crossconnection means a connection or potential connection between any part of a potable water system and any other environment containing other substances in a manner that under any circumstances would allow such substances to enter the potable water system other substances may be gases liquids or solids such as chemicals waste products steam water from other sources potable or nonpotable or any other matter that may change the color andor add odor to the water crossconnection control by containment means the installation of an approved backflow prevention device at the water service connection to any customers premises where it is physically and economically infeasible to find and permanently eliminate or control all actual or potential crossconnections within the customers water system  or it shall mean the installation of an approved backflow prevention device on the service line leading to and supplying a portion of a customers water system where there are actual or potential crossconnections which cannot be effectively eliminated or controlled at the point of the crossconnection crossconnection controlled means a connection between a potable water system and a nonpotable water system with an approved backflow prevention device properly installed and maintained so that it will continuously afford the protection commensurate with the degree of hazard customer means a person or entity receiving water or sewer services from the city of americus public works department department means the city of americus public works department doublecheck backflow preventer means an assembly of two independently operating springloaded check valves with tightlyclosing shut off valves on each side of the check valves and properly located test cocks allowing for the testing of each check valve on each line specifically a doublecheck valve assembly dcva or a doublecheck detector assembly dcda hazard assessment means a hazard determination conducted pursuant to of the georgia state minimum standard plumbing degree of means the term is derived from an evaluation of the potential risk to public health and the adverse effect of the hazard upon the potable water system hazard health means any condition device or practice in the water supply system and its operation which could create or in the judgment of the building official may create a danger to the health and wellbeing of the water consumer hazard plumbing means a plumbingtype crossconnection in a consumers potable water system that has not been properly protected by an approved air gap or approved backflow prevention device hazard pollutional means an actual or potential threat to the physical properties of the water system or to the potability of the public or the consumers potable water system but which would constitute a nuisance or be aesthetically objectionable or could cause damage to the system or its appurtenances but would not be dangerous to health hazard system means an actual or potential threat of severe damage to the physical properties of the public potable water system or the consumers potable water system or of a pollution or contamination which would have a protracted effect on the quality of the potable water in the system industrial fluids system means any system containing a fluid or solution which may be chemically biologically or otherwise contaminated or polluted in a form or concentration such as would constitute a health system pollutional or plumbing hazard if introduced into an approved water supply this may include but is not limited to polluted or contaminated waters  all types of process waters and used waters originating from the public potable water system which may have deteriorated in sanitary quality  chemicals in fluid form  plating acids and alkalies  circulating cooling water connected to an open cooling tower andor cooling towers that are chemically or biologically treated or stabilized with toxic substances  contaminated natural waters such as from wells springs streams rivers bays harbors seas irrigation canals or systems etc  oils gases glycerine paraffins caustic and acid solutions and other liquid and gaseous fluids used in industrial or other purposes or for firefighting purposes owner means any person who has legal title to or license to operate or inhabit a property upon which a crossconnection inspection is to be made or upon which a crossconnection is deemed likely by the city of americus public works permit means a document issued by the department which allows the installation of a backflow preventer person means any individual partnership company public or private corporation political subdivision or agency of the state department agency or instrumentality or the united states or any other legal entity pollutant means a foreign substance that if permitted to get into the public water system will degrade its quality so as to constitute a moderate hazard or impair the usefulness or quality of the water to a degree that does not create an actual hazard to the public health but which does adversely and unreasonably affect such water for domestic use reduced pressure principle backflow preventer means an assembly consisting of two independently operating approved check valves with an automatically operating differential relief valve located between the two check valves tightlyclosing shutoff valves on each side of the check valves and properly located test cocks allowing for the testing of the check valves and the relief valve on each line specifically a reduced pressure principal assembly rp or a reduced pressure principal detector assembly rpda residential dual check means an assembly of two spring loaded independently operating check valves without tightly closing shutoff valves or test cocks generally employed immediately downstream of the water meter to act as a containment device water service connection means the terminal end of a service connection from the public potable water system ie where the water purveyor loses jurisdiction and sanitary control over the water at its point of delivery to the customers water system if a meter is installed at the end of the service connection then the term service connection shall mean the downstream end of the meter there shall be no unprotected takeoffs from the service line ahead of any meter or backflow prevention device located at the point of delivery to the customers water system service connection shall also include water service connection from a fire hydrant and all other temporary or emergency water service connections from the public potable water system water used means any water supplied by the city from the public potable water system to a consumers water system after it has passed point of delivery and is no longer under the sanitary control of the city water department exh a 11172011 purpose the purpose of this article is to 1 protect the public potable water supply of the city from the possibility of contamination or pollution by containing within the customers internal distribution systems or the customers private water systems such contaminates or pollutants which could backflow into the public water system undiscovered or uncontrolled crossconnection on said premises  2 promote the elimination or control of existing crossconnections actual or potential between the customers inplant potable water systems and nonpotable water systems plumbing fixtures and industrial piping systems  and 3 provide for the maintenance of a continuing program of crossconnection control which will systematically attempt to prevent the contamination or pollution of all potable water systems exh a 11172011 protection of system  fees and charges  installation of assemblies a in accordance with the federal safe drinking water act of 197 and the georgia rules for safe drinking water 13 the water purveyor city of americus public works has the primary responsibility for preventing water from unapproved sources or any other substances from entering the public potable water system b the city of americus is authorized to charge a nominal fee to water customers for the purpose of funding the crossconnection control program the city of americus is also authorized to charge an additional fee to businesses for funding the crossconnection control program and the associated inspections should a water customer fail to comply with the requirements set out herein the city of americus has the authority to install test and repair backflow prevention assemblies and pass on costs to the customer associated with the work including but not limited to labor parts and administration the city of americus public works department has the authority to hire or designate an oncall or consulting engineer to offer support with tasks associated with upkeep of the crossconnection control program exh a 11172011   obligations and responsibilities the following obligations shall be undertaken and performed by the named persons or entities 1 purveyor the director of public works for the city of americus georgia or a designee on his or her behalf as authorized article is primarily responsible for preventing contamination and pollution of the public water supply by instituting the crossconnection control program as approved by the georgia environmental protection division such responsibility begins at the point of origin for the public potable water supply includes all of the distribution system and terminates at the service connection for the customers water system in addition the director shall exercise reasonable vigilance to ensure that the customer adheres to this policy and these procedures as stated and outlined herein 2 customer the business and residential customers will be responsible for all work and costs related to installing certifying and maintaining the required backflow assemblies the required customersupplied backflow prevention assembly at the service connection shall provide maximum protection for locations deemed high hazard reduced pressure principal backflow preventer  rp rpda or air gap or minimum protection for locations deemed low hazard doublecheck backflow preventer  dcva dcda as directed by the department or an authorized representative thereof 3 building code official the building inspection department is primarily responsible for enforcing the state of georgia plumbing prevent contamination and pollution within the customers water system in accordance with applicable plumbing and building codes requiring that all outlets terminate approved air gap or be controlled by an approved mechanical backflow prevention device such responsibility begins at the service connection to the premises and extends to the extremities of the customers potable water supply exh a 11172011   water system components the water system shall be considered as made up of two parts the utility system and the customer system 1 utility system the utility system shall consist of the source facilities and the distribution system and shall include all those facilities of the water system under the complete control of the city up to the point where the customers system begins a source facilities the source shall include all components of the facilities utilized in the production treatment storage and delivery of water to the distribution system b distribution system the distribution system shall include the network of conduits used for the delivery of water from the source to the customers system 2 customers system the customers system shall include those parts of the facilities beyond the termination of the utility distribution system which are utilized in conveying utilitydelivered domestic water to points of use exh a 11172011 connection policy a no water service connection to any premises shall be installed or maintained by the city unless the water supply is protected as required by state law and regulations and this article the city of americus shall either discontinue service of water to any premises or take appropriate steps by installing testing or maintaining a backflow prevention assembly if one is required by this article and state law and has not been tested and maintained or if it is found that a required backflow prevention assembly has been removed or bypassed or if an unprotected crossconnection exists on the premises in the event of disconnection service will not be restored until such conditions or defects are corrected compliance with applicable requirements for backflow prevention shall be verified by the department before water service is reinstated b the customers system shall be open for inspection at all reasonable times to the department or authorized representatives of the department to determine whether crossconnections or other structural or sanitary hazards including violations of these regulations exist when such a condition becomes known the department shall either immediately discontinue service to the premises by providing for a physical break in the service line until the customer has corrected the conditions in conformance with state statutes and city ordinances relating to plumbing and water supplies and the regulations adopted pursuant thereto or take appropriate steps by installing testing or maintaining the assembly to correct the conditions in conformance with state statutes and city ordinances relating to plumbing and water supplies and the regulations adopted pursuant thereto all costs incurred shall be passed directly to the customer exh a 11172011 installation of assembly in service line an approved backflow prevention assembly shall also be installed on each service line to a customers water system at or near the property line or immediately inside the building being served  but in all cases before the first branch line leading off the service line wherever the following conditions exist 1 auxiliary water supply in the case of premises having an auxiliary water supply which is not or may not be of safe bacteriological or chemical quality and which is not acceptable as an additional source by the building official the public water system shall be protected against backflow from the premises by eliminating the connection between the two systems 2 industrial fluid or hazardous substances in the case of premises on which any industrial fluid or any other objectionable substance is handled in such a fashion as to create an actual or potential hazard to the public water system the public system shall be protected against backflow from the premises by installing an approved backflow prevention assembly in the service line appropriate to the degree of hazard this shall include the handling of process waters and waters originating from the utility system which have been subject to deterioration in quality 3 connection issues in the case of premises having a internal crossconnections that cannot be permanently corrected and controlled  b intricate plumbing and piping arrangements  or c where entry to all portions of the premises is not readily accessible for inspection purposes making it impracticable or impossible to ascertain whether or not dangerous crossconnections exist the public water system shall be protected against backflow from the premises by installing an approved backflow prevention assembly in the service line 4 water heating or pressure producing device in the case of premises having any water heating device or any other pressureproducing device connected to the customers system a thermal protection device either a thermal expansion tank or a calibrated pressurerelief valve set at 80 psi will be required in order to protect against damage caused by thermal expansion of a system closed with backflow preventer exh a 11172011 type of assembly the type of protective assembly required under subsections 902813 shall depend upon the degree of hazard which exists as follows 1 auxiliary water supply in the case of any premises where there is an auxiliary water supply as stated in subsection 90281 and it is not subject to any of the following rules the public water system shall be protected by an approved air gap separation or an approved reduced pressure principle backflow prevention assembly 2 objectionable substances in the case of any premises where there is water or substance that would be objectionable but not hazardous to health if introducted into the public water system the public water system shall be protected by an approved doublecheck valve assembly 3 hazardous substances in the case of any premises where there is any material dangerous to health which is handled in such a fashion as to create an actual or potential hazard to the public water system the public water system shall be protected by an approved air gap separation or any approved reduced pressure principle backflow prevention assembly examples of premises where these conditions will exist include sewage treatment plants sewage pumping stations chemical manufacturing plants hospitals mortuaries and plating plants 4 connection issues in the case of any premises where there are uncontrolled crossconnections either actual or potential the public water system shall be protected by an approved air gap separation or an approved reduced pressure principle backflow prevention assembly at the service connection 5 other prohibitions or restrictions in the case of any premises where because of security requirements or other prohibitions or restrictions it is impossible or impractical to make a complete inplant crossconnection survey the public water system shall be protected against backflow from the premises by either an approved air gap separation or an approved reduced pressure principle backflow prevention assembly on each service to the premises 6 unknown hazards in the case of any premises where there is no known pollutional or contaminant hazard as described or covered in subsections 1 5 of this section the public water system shall be protected by an approved residential dualcheck valve at the service connection exh a 11172011 approved backflow prevention assembly any backflow prevention assembly device assembly required herein shall be a model and size approved by the building official the term approved backflow prevention assembly shall mean an assembly that has been manufactured in full conformance with the standards established in the city and state plumbing codes exh a 11172011 tests  repair of assemblies a periodic testing annual testing shall be performed by a tester certified by one of the approved programs this testing will be coordinated by the owner and performed at the owners expense assemblies shall also be tested immediately following installation repair or relocation of an assembly test reports must be submitted within seven days from the date that the test is performed any backflow preventer that fails during a periodic test will be repaired or replaced when repairs are necessary upon completion of the repair the assembly will be retested at the customers expense to insure correct operation in situations where the public water system is not deemed by the department to be immediately threatened by a health or pollutional hazard a compliance date of not more than 30 days after the test date will be established if a customer does not comply with installation testing or repair within 60 days of notifications the department may perform installation testing or repair and bill the customer for the cost of the work parts and any associated administrative costs b backflow assembly testers in accordance with the state of georgia environmental protection division requirements backflow testers for the city of americus must be certified by one of the state of georgia approved agencies in order to test backflow assemblies certification is valid for up to three years or until such time as his or her certification expires whichever comes first in order to certify backflow prevention assemblies for the city of americus testers must complete an application including but not limited to a copy of his or her current tester certificate from one of the approved agencies a copy of the current calibration certificate of the approved backflow gauge to be used by the tester and the business license under which he or she will be practicing a list of testers will be published and made available to customers who require a backflow assembly test c backflow assembly repairs all backflow assembly repairs shall be performed by a person or persons working under a current plumbers license d backflow assembly installation in accordance with state of georgias crossconnection control requirements all installations of backflow assemblies shall be performed by a person or persons working under a current plumbers license exh a 11172011   installation of residential dualchecks residential dualchecks shall be installed by the department or a designee thereof exh a 11172011 nonconforming devices all presently installed backflow prevention devices which do not meet the requirements of this section but were approved devices for the purposes described herein at the time of installation and which have been properly maintained shall except for the inspection and maintenance requirements under section 9031 be excluded from the requirements of these rules so long as the building official is assured that they will satisfactorily protect the utility system whenever the existing device is moved from the present location or requires more than minimum maintenance or when the building official finds that the maintenance constitutes a hazard to health the unit shall be replaced by an approved backflow prevention device meeting the requirements of this section     6271985   secs 90339052  reserved article iii  water and sewer line extensions division 1  generally secs 90539077  reserved division 2  commercial areas authority to extend  service charges a the city council shall be authorized to extend or cause to be extended water main lines and sewer main lines into commercial areas both inside and outside the city limits where the city council deems it appropriate and in the best interest of the city to do so b in considering the extension of such water mains and sewer mains the city council shall take into consideration past commercial business growth patterns and anticipated commercial business growth patterns both inside and outside the city limits the city council shall also weigh the net cost to the city of such extensions against the potential increased revenues to the city realized or anticipated to result from such extensions due to increased economic development activity c in the event that the city council determines that it is appropriate to extend water mains and sewer mains into commercial areas either inside or outside the city limits the city shall be authorized to charge to new water and sewer customers in addition to tap charges service deposits meter costs and monthly water and sewer rates an amount determined by the city which will reimburse the city for all reasonable costs of extending such water mains and sewer mains based upon the linear front footage of the property to be served by such water main and sewer main extensions such costs need not be paid by a property owner or owners until such time as the property owner or owners desire to purchase city water and city sewer services and such charges may be paid as part of the initial tap charges otherwise authorized in this addition to the foregoing the city shall be authorized to charge interest on such amounts from the date that such water and sewer service becomes available to the date that such charges are paid in an amount to be determined by the city d the charges authorized hereunder shall be in addition to all other charges authorized to persons or businesses who utilize city water and city sewer services whether inside or outside the city limits e the commercial business shall be required to pay the full cost of installing water and sewer lines from the main line to a commercial business building or buildings located on the premises and the city shall have no responsibility or liability therefor f the provisions of this section shall not apply to residential subdivisions or to the extension of water mains and sewer mains by the city to serve a single residence or a single commercial business under such circumstances the city shall be authorized to undertake such extensions and shall be authorized to charge the full cost of such extensions to such residential or commercial customer    secs 90799099  reserved division 3  residential areas authority to extend the city council shall be authorized to extend or cause to be extended water main lines and sewer main lines into residential areas both inside and outside the city limits where the city council deems it appropriate and in the best interest of the city to do so for purposes of this division the term residential areas shall include all areas inside and outside the city limits which are zoned for any type of residential development    1 1211999 investigation  survey  estimated costs a in the event that the utilities director shall determine that there is an area within the city or outside the city limits which should have access to city water and city sewerage the utilities director shall conduct a preliminary investigation of the area to determine the estimated cost feasibility and if appropriate the time frame within which water mains and sewer mains could be installed to serve such area the utilities director shall then make a written report of his findings to the city manager of the city who shall review such findings and submit them to the city council for review b upon review of the findings the city council shall be authorized to undertake one of the following three options 1 the council can determine that the proposed installation of water and sewer lines in such area is not feasible not cost effective or is a project that the city should not undertake at the present time 2 in the event that the area studied is an area where residential property has already been developed then the city council shall be authorized to direct the city manager of the city to undertake a survey of the property owners in the area to determine whether or not they desire the construction of such improvements in the area an estimated cost of such extension that would have to be paid by such property owners if any shall be submitted to said property owners as part of such survey unless the city council shall determine that public health and safety concerns exist so as to require such installation in the discretion of the city council no such extension shall be undertaken by the city unless at least 60 percent of the property owners in the subject area respond affirmatively to such survey 3 in the event that the subject area has not been developed as a residential area then the city council shall direct the city manager to conduct a survey as referred to in subsection b2 of this section of the property owners in the subject area in the same manner unless the city council shall determine that public health and safety concerns exist so as to require such installation in the discretion of the city council no such extension shall be undertaken by the city unless 100 percent of the property owners in the subject area respond affirmatively to such survey    2 1211999   completion of survey  determination of special or general benefits a the survey shall be completed within 90 days after the city manager is directed to commence such survey in the event that the required percentage approval from the property owners is met as a result of the survey or in the event that the city council determines that public health and safety concerns exist so as to require the installation of the water and sewer improvements the city council shall determine whether or not a special benefit will accrue to those property owners gaining access to the citys water and sewer system in the event that such a special benefit will accrue as determined by the city council the city council shall compare such special benefit with the general benefit derived by taxpayers of the city in general as a result of such improvements if the comparison of the special benefit to the general benefit derived by taxpayers of the city in general results in a conclusion that the special benefit to the taxpayers of the subject area in expanding the water and sewer system to said area will outweigh the general benefit derived by taxpayers of the city in general then in such event the city council shall determine what portion of the cost of extending the citys water and sewer line to the subject area will be paid by the city if any if the city council determines that the general benefit to be derived by taxpayers of the city in general outweighs the special benefit to the property owners in the subject area then the city shall pay the total cost of the extension of the water and sewer line b in the event that the city determines there is a special benefit to the property owners in the subject area the city shall determine what portion of such cost each property owner shall pay for such water and sewer extension if finally approved the portion of the cost of the water and sewer line extension payable by the property owners in the subject area shall be paid to the city in accord with the provisions of this division    3 1211999   boundary of subject area  total costs  assessment a at the next regular meeting of the city council after completion of the survey and the tabulations of the results thereof or at such other time as the city council may determine the city council may consider a resolution establishing the boundary of the subject area to be served by the water and sewer extensions and identifying all of the property or properties in the subject area which will benefit from access to such extension such resolution shall also provide the following 1 the total cost of the proposed project  2 the proposed method of assessment as to each property owner  3 a good faith estimate of the proposed assessment against each property  and 4 a date place and time for a public hearing to be held on the merits of the project and on any objections thereto b such resolution if approved by the city council shall be deemed to conditionally approve the project under the terms and conditions as set out in the resolution but such project shall not proceed until after the public hearing and after the city council has approved a final resolution approving the project in accord with the terms of such final resolution c notice of the public hearing referred to in subsection b of this section shall be given to every property owner identified in the preliminary resolution as potentially benefiting from access to the proposed water and sewer line improvements such notice shall be given in writing and mailed to such property owners by certified mail return receipt requested at the address shown on the city tax digest for the mailing of tax notices such notices shall be mailed at least 15 days prior to the date of the public hearing and shall include a copy of the preliminary resolution as approved by the city council such notice shall also specify the date time and location of the hearing and advise such property owners of their right to attend said hearing and to testify at said hearing such notice shall also be published by the city manager or his designee at least once a week for two consecutive weeks in the legal organ of the city the time fixed for the public hearing shall be not less than five nor more than ten days after the date of the last publication of such notice d the city council shall hold the public hearing on the date time and place specified for the purpose of hearing supporting comments complaints objections that may be made by any interested persons concerning the project including but not limited to the need for such water and sewer extension the basis of apportioning costs between the city and the property owners or the amount of the proposed assessment the city council shall consider such comments and shall also be authorized to accept written comments from interested parties e at the next regular meeting of the city council or at such other time as the city council may direct the city council shall be authorized to consider a final resolution authorizing the project such resolution shall not be approved at the meeting at which it is first read without unanimous consent of the members of the city council but shall be voted upon by the city council at the time of the second reading of such resolution such resolution shall include but shall not be limited to the following determinations 1 the boundary of the subject area to be served by the water and sewer extension  2 the projected cost of the improvements  3 the proposed method of assessment of such costs against the property owners  4 a good faith estimate of the proposed assessment against each property owner  and 5 the date on which such assessments shall be due and payable to the city    4 1211999   notice of assessment a the city manager of the city or his designee shall not less than 30 days before the date on which the payment of an assessment shall be due cause written notice of such assessment to be sent to each affected property owner by certified mail return receipt requested the notice shall inform the property owner of the amount of the assessment that the assessment is payable to the finance director of the city that if paid on or before the due date such assessment shall be without interest and that if such assessment is not paid by the due date the amount of such assessment shall be a lien against the lot or tracts of land subject to the assessment and such lien shall continue in force until the assessment and all interest is fully paid the interest to be charged on assessments not paid when due shall be determined by the city council in the final resolution in section 90103 b in addition to the foregoing notice of the property owners right to pay such assessment in installments as provided in this division shall also be contained in the notice required under this section    5 1211999     action to enjoin or contest assessments no action shall be authorized to set aside any assessment to enjoin the collection of any assessment to enjoin the issuance of any execution therefor or to contest the validity of an assessment on any legal or equitable grounds unless such action is commenced within 30 days after the receipt of the notice provided for in section 90104    6 1211999 payment of assessment by installments when an assessment is imposed against a property owner for the installation of water and sewer lines as set out in this division and the property owner desires to pay the assessment in installments the property owner shall be authorized to pay such assessment in installments if notice of such election shall be given by the property to the chief administrator officer of the city on or before the due date of the assessment subject to the following terms 1 the assessment may be amortized over such length of time as requested by the property owner but no such assessment may be amortized over more than seven years 2 the interest rate to be charged to a property owner shall be based upon the cost of funds to the city in connection with such project plus administrative expenses and costs incurred by the city in administering the payments notwithstanding the foregoing in the event that the water and sewer line extension project is paid for with cash funds from the citys water and sewer fund the interest rate to be charged to property owners who amortize their assessment shall be the rate that the money expended for such extension would have earned if such money had been invested in oneyear certificates of deposit plus administrative expenses and costs incurred by the city in administering the payments 3 each assessment amortized as provided in this section shall be repaid in equal monthly installments of principal and interest according to an amortization schedule provided by the city manager such assessments shall be evidenced by a promissory note and such other documents as may be deemed necessary or appropriate to evidence such indebtedness and to secure the repayment thereof in the event that the property owner is a utility customer of the city the city shall be authorized to add the monthly installment to the monthly utility bill of the property owner in the event the property owner is not a utility customer of the city a monthly installment shall be billed to the property owner by the city 4 the amount of the assessment shall be a lien against the property of the property owner subject to such assessment until such time as all principal and interest are fully paid such liens shall be levied enforced and collected in the same manner as provided for the collection of city taxes 5 in the event that any installment is not paid in full when due the finance director of the city shall be authorized to notify the property owner that the assessment is in default and such officer shall be further authorized to declare the entire unpaid balance with interest costs and expenses immediately due and payable 6 upon the sale donation gift or other transfer by operation of law of any real property subject to such a lien such assessment shall be due and payable in full at the time of such transfer  provided however that transfers of property solely for the purpose of securing a bona fide indebtedness of the property owner shall not require payment in full of such lien upon such transfer 7 notwithstanding the other provisions of this section regarding the repayment of such assessments amortized over a period of years in the event that the subject area has no residential dwellings located on it at the time of the approval of the final resolution approving the project as provided in this division then in such event the property owners shall be authorized to enter into an agreement with the city to provide that such assessment shall be paid with interest as aforesaid at the time that each lot in the proposed development is sold provided that the entire assessment whether or not all lots subject to such assessment have been sold shall be paid no later than seven years from the initial due date of the assessment all other provisions of this division relating to interest rates liens for assessments and default shall be applicable to such property owners    7 1211999     special fund for assessments all assessments levied and collected under this division shall be retained by the finance director of the city in a special fund to be used and applied for the payment of expenses incurred in installing and extending water and sewer lines for the project identified in the final resolution referred to in this division no money in said special fund shall be used for any other purpose until such time as all costs of such project have been paid in full in the event that any funds remain in the special fund after the project has been paid for in full then such remaining funds shall be transferred to the city water and sewer fund    8 1211999   property required to connect and pay monthly usage cost upon approval of the final resolution referred to in this division authorizing the commencement of the project in the subject area the city shall be authorized to require that each property in the subject area which is to benefit from the extension of the water and sewer lines as a result of such project shall be required to connect to such water and sewer lines and pay the monthly usage cost as established under this chapter in addition to the payment of such assessments as may be levied under the terms of this division    9 1211999 reserved division 4  annexation of residential and commercial areas annexation application  utility extensions upon any property owner submitting an application for annexation of such property owners property into the city under any applicable method installation of water tap fees or installation of sewer tap fees or all of the above property owner means the person or entity which owns fee simple title to the subject property and is the annexation extended to such property without excessive costs without placing an undue burden upon the capacity of the utility system and without permanently disrupting utility service to existing city utility service customers sewer line extension costs means the cost to be incurred by the city is extending existing city sewerage line from the existing city sewerage system to a location from which the subject property could be served such cost shall include but shall not be limited to the cost of easement or rightorway acquisition subject property means the improved real property located outside acquisition  initial review of application if the property to be annexed is qualified property as defined in this division and if the property owner makes appropriate application for the extension of water and sewer services to the property to be annexed under this division then the community development department working in conjunction with the city utilities department and the city fire and emergency services department shall undertake an initial review of the application if such departments determine as a result of such initial review that the property to be annexed is qualified property under this division then the departments shall jointly determine whether it is economically feasible from a financial standpoint for the governing body to provide the property owner as a condition of annexation reduced costs and fees for water line extensions sewer line extensions water tap fees and sewer tap fees no such cost or fee reductions shall be authorized unless the net cost of such project shall result in a financial benefit to the city  financial benefit determination in determining financial benefit to the city in connection with such project said departments shall perform a cost analysis to determine the cost of water line extensions sewer line extensions water tap fees and sewer tap fees to the subject property such analysis shall include consideration of the following 1 cost to extend water lines  2 cost to extend sewer lines  3 cost for project engineering  4 cost of water tap fees  5 cost of sewer tap fees  6 cost of stormwater fees  7 estimated revenue to city from ad valorem property taxes water service fees sewer service fees garbage fees and stormwater fees  and 8 any other information that either department deems appropriate to include in connection with such analysis  recommendation to city council the departments shall jointly recommend to the governing body of the city the actual amount of fee reductions if any that would be authorized for the proposed project based upon such calculations conditioned upon the subject property being annexed into the city  provided however that in no event shall fee reductions exceed a sevenyear payback to the city which shall be calculated solely based upon increased ad valorem tax revenue to the city generated by the subject property  payment of fees in installments under certain circumstances with respect to any water line extension costs sewer line extensions costs water tap fees or sewer tap fees which are to be paid by a property owner annexing property into the city i where the subject property is not qualified property as defined in section 90111  ii where all or a portion of such fees are not subject to a reduction under section 90114 above  or iii where the governing body of the city does not approve a fee reduction with respect to a particular application the property owner may apply to the city to pay such costs and fees in installments the property owners application to pay such costs and fees or a portion thereof in installments may be authorized if approved by the governing body of the city subject to the following terms 1 the governing body of the city must determine based upon the financial benefit determination that the project would bring economic development to the city in the form of increased private sector employment increased ad valorem tax revenue to the city or increased net revenue to the citys utility system 2 the costs and fees may be amortized over such length of time as approved by the governing body of the city but the repayment of such costs and fees may not be amortized over a period of more than seven years 3 the interest rate to be charged to a property owner in connection with the payment of such installment payments shall be as determined by the governing body of the city taking into account the cost of funds to the city in connection with the project current prevailing interest rates in the private sector plus administrative costs and expenses incurred and to be incurred by the city in collecting and administering such installment payments 4 such costs and fees to be paid in installments shall be repaid in equal monthly installments of principal and interest according to a written amortization schedule at the time that the city and the property owner agree to the monthly repayment amounts the property owner shall execute and deliver to the city the property owners promissory note and such other documents as may be deemed necessary or appropriate to evidence such indebtedness and to secure the repayment thereof in the event that the property owner is a utility customer of the city the city shall be authorized to add the monthly installment payment to the monthly utility bill of the property owner or the property owners tenant in the case of leased property 5 prior to any installment payment being authorized under this section the property owner must be determined by the governing body to be sufficiently creditworthy to insure to the governing body to the extent reasonably possible that the property owner will have the financial ability to pay such indebtedness within the term established by the city 6 the amount of the costs and fees to be paid in installments shall constitute a lien against the property of the property owner benefitted by such utility services until such time as all principal and interest are paid in full evidence of such lien shall be executed by the property owner and shall be recorded in the deed records in the office the clerk of the superior court of sumter county georgia the city clerk shall be authorized to cancel such lien upon the full payment thereof such liens shall be levied enforced and collected in the same manner as provided for the collection of city ad valorem taxes 7 upon the sale donation gift foreclosure or the transfer of or operation of law of all or a portion of the real property subject to such lien any remaining unpaid amounts of such costs and fees shall be due and payable in full at the time of such transfer unless the governing body of the city approves the assumption of such remaining obligations by the person or entity acquiring all or a portion of the subject property  secs 9011690129  reserved article iv  water system division 1  generally access to private property  discovery multiple use a each house store building place of business or residential premises which desires to have water service shall have a separate meter and be separately connected to said meter except as hereinafter provided b the term residential premises means 1 a singlefamily apartment unit  2 a singlefamily dwelling house  3 a singlefamily mobile home dwelling unit c where a multiple residential premises is served master meter the owner of the multiple residential premises shall be required to pay a base water charge for each singlefamily residential premises and in addition thereto the owner shall also pay all charges for actual water used at the premises to be calculated based upon the current city water rate schedule as approved by the city council d where a multiple residential premises is served master meter the bill for such water charge shall be to the owner of the property served by such master meter e the term business premises means a premises upon which a business is being conducted f the term multiplebusiness premises means a premises upon which two or more businesses are located g where a multiplebusiness premises is served master meter the owner of the multiplebusiness premises shall be required to pay a base water charge for each separate business location constituting said multiple business premises whether occupied or not located upon the multiple business premises and in addition thereto said owner shall also pay all charges for actual water used at the premises to be calculated based upon the current city water rate schedule as approved by the city council h where a multiplebusiness premises is served master meter the bill for such water charge shall be to the owner of the property served by such master meter i a master meter will not be allowed to serve a multiple residential or business premises except in those instances where all of the premises of such multiple premises are under a single ownership j notwithstanding the foregoing where a newly constructed or renovated multiple residential premises is served master meter for each unit actually rented during the first two months after completion of such construction or renovation the owner shall only be required to pay a base water charge plus payment for any water used such twomonth period is to begin on the date the owner makes application for a sanitation receptacle for such premises the electric utility providing service to the premises shall be contacted each month during such twomonth period by the finance directors office to verify the actual number of units having electric power on the meter reading date such number of units having electric power on the meter reading date shall be deemed to be units actually rented for the purposes of this section at the conclusion of said twomonth period the owner shall be required to pay a base water charge plus any water used above or in excess of such base charge for all units located at the premises whether or not such units are rented for purposes of this section the term renovated multiple residential premises means a multiple residential premises renovated to such an extent that all tenants thereof were required to vacate the premises being renovated during the renovation process        sametampering with meter or lock a it shall be unlawful for any person to tamper with any article v  sewers and sewage disposal division 1  generally secs 9022290250  reserved division 2  sewer use requirements purpose and objectives of division  administration a the purpose of this division is to regulate the use of public and private sewers and drains private wastewater disposal the installation and connection of building sewers and the discharge of waters and waste into the public sewer system and to provide penalties for violations thereof in the city all connections of lateral or other sewer lines to the sewerage system of the city service area whether within or without the city limits shall be made subject to such terms and conditions as the city may prescribe this division enables the city to comply with all applicable state and federal laws required by the clean water act of 1977 and the general pretreatment regulations 40 cfr 403 b the objectives of this division are 1 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the municipal wastewater system which will interfere with operations of the system or contaminate the resulting sludge  2 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the municipal wastewater system which will pass system inadequately treated into receiving waters or the atmosphere or otherwise be incompatible with the system  3 to improve the opportunity to recycle and reclaim wastewater and sludges from the system  4 to enable the city to comply with its national pollutant discharge elimination system permit conditions sludge use and disposal requirements and any other federal or state laws to which the potw is subject  5 to provide for the regulation of direct and indirect contributors to the municipal wastewater system of permits to certain nondomestic users and of general requirements for the other users  and 6 to authorize monitoring and enforcement activities user reporting and provide for the setting of fees for the equitable distribution of costs resulting from the program established herein c except as otherwise provided herein the utilities director shall administer implement and enforce the provisions of this division any powers or duties granted to or upon the utilities director may be delegated to a duly authorized representative    definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning act or the act means the federal water pollution control act also known as the clean water act as amended 33 usc 1251 et seq authorized representative of the user means 1 if the user is a corporation a the president secretary treasurer or vicepresident of the corporation in charge of a principal business function or any other person who performs similar policy or decisionmaking functions for the corporation  or b the manager of one or more manufacturing production or operation facilities employing more than 250 persons or having a gross annual sales or expenditures exceeding $2500000000 in second quarter 1980 dollars if authority to sign documents has been assigned or delegated to the manager in accordance with corporate procedures 2 if the user is a partnership or sole proprietorship a general partner or proprietor respectively 3 if the user is a federal state or local government facility a director or highest official appointed or designated to oversee the operation and performance of the activities of the government facility or their designee 4 the individuals described in subsections 13 of this section may designate another authorized representative if the authorization is in writing the authorization specifies the individual or position responsible for the overall operation of the facility from which the discharge originates or having overall responsibility for the environmental matters for the company and the written authorization is submitted to the city biochemical oxygen demand or bod means the quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under epa approved laboratory procedures in five days at 20 degrees centigrade expressed as a concentration eg mgl building drain means that part of the lowest horizontal piping of a drainage system which receives the discharge from soil waste and other drainage pipes inside the walls of buildings and conveys it to the building sewer beginning five feet outside the inner face of the building wall building sewer means the extension from the building drain to the public sewer or other place of disposal also called house connection or service connection categorical standards means any regulation containing pollutant discharge limits promulgated by epa in accordance with section 307b and c of the act 33 usc 1317 which applies to a specific category of users and which appear in 40 cfr chapter 1 subchapter n parts 405471 combined sewer means a sewer receiving both surface runoff and sewage composite means the makeup of a number discharge flow of a pretreatment facility equalizing unit means those devices or structures constructed to regulate evenly either or both the strength and volumes of wastes flammable shall be defined by existing fire regulations floatable oil means oil fat or grease in a physical state such that it will separate by gravity from wastewater by treatment in an approved pretreatment facility flush toilet means the common sanitary flush commode in general use for the disposal of human excrement garbage means the animal and vegetable waste resulting from the handling preparation cooking and natural outlet means any outlet including storm sewers and combined sewer overflows into a watercourse pond ditch lake or other body of surface water or groundwater new source means 1 any building structure facility or installation from which there is or may be a discharge of pollutants the construction of which commenced after the publication of proposed pretreatment standards under section 307c of the act which will be applicable to such source if such standards are thereafter promulgated in accordance with that section provided that a the building structure facility or installation is constructed at a site at which no other source is located  b the building structure facility or installation totally replaces the process or production equipment that causes the discharge of pollutants at an existing source  or c the production or wastewater generating processes of the building structure facility or installation are substantially independent of an existing source at the same site in determining whether these are substantially independent factors such as the extent to which the new facility is integrated with the existing plant and the extent to which the new facility is engaged in the same general type of activity as the existing source should be considered 2 construction on a site at which an existing source is located results in a modification rather then a new source if the construction does not create a new building structure facility or installation meeting the criteria of subsections 1b or c of this definition but otherwise alters replaces or adds to existing process or production equipment 3 construction of a new source means or has commenced if the owner or operator has a begun or caused to begin as part of a continuous onsite construction program 1 any placement assembly or installation of facilities or equipment  2 significant site preparation work including clearing excavation or removal of existing buildings structures or facilities which is necessary for the placement assembly or installation of new source facilities or equipment  or b entered into a binding contractual obligation for the purchase of facilities or equipment which are intended to be used in its operation within a reasonable time options to purchase or contracts which can be terminated or modified without substantial loss and contracts for feasibility engineering and design studies that do not constitute a contractual obligation under this definition pass a discharge which exits the potw into the waters of the united states in quantities or concentrations which alone or in conjunction with a discharge or discharges from other sources is a cause of a violation of any requirement of the potws npdes permit ph means the logarithm base 10 of the reciprocal of the concentration of hydrogen ions pit privy means a shored vertical pit in the earth completely covered with a flytight slab on which is securely located a flytight riser covered with hinged flytight seat and lid polluted water means that wastewater leaving the users premises to which contaminants have been added so as to render the water nonpotable potw or publicly owned treatment works means any devices and systems used in the storage treatment recycling and reclamation of municipal or industrial wastes of a liquid nature this includes sewers pipes and other conveyances only if they convey wastewater to the potw treatment plant potw treatment plant means that portion of the potw which is designed to provide treatment including recycling and reclamation of municipal or industrial waste pretreatment or treatment means the reduction of the amount of pollutants the elimination of pollutants or the alteration of the nature of pollutant properties in wastewater to a less harmful state prior to or in lieu of discharge or otherwise introduction of such pollutants into a potw properly shredded garbage means the wastes from the preparation cooking and dispensing of food that has been shredded to such a degree that all particles will be carried freely under the flow conditions normally prevailing in public sewers with no particle greater than onehalf inch in any dimension public sewer means a sewer which is owned and controlled or controlled by the city receiving waters means those waters into which wastes are discharged sanitary sewer means a sewer that carries liquid and waterborne wastes from residences commercial buildings industrial plants and institutions together with minor quantities of groundwater stormwater and surface water that are not intentionally admitted septic tank means a surface impervious tank designed to temporarily retain sewage or similar waterborne wastes together with 1 a sewer line constructed with solid pipe with the joints sealed connecting the impervious tank with a plumbing stub out  and 2 a subsurface system of trenches piping and other materials constructed to drain the clarified liquid from the tank and distribute it underground to be absorbed or filtered sewer means a pipe or conduit that carries wastewater sic means and is an acronym for standard industrial classification significant industrial user means  1 any industrial user of the citys wastewater disposal system who is a a user subject to categorical pretreatment standards  or b a user that discharges an average of 25000 gpd or more of process wastewater to the potw excluding sanitary noncontact cooling and boiler blowdown wastewater  contributes a process wastestream which makes up five percent or more of the average dry weather hydraulic or organic capacity of the potw treatment plant  or is designated as such by the city on the basis that it has reasonable potential for adversely affecting the potws operation or for violating any pretreatment standard or requirement 2 upon a finding that an industrial user meeting the criteria in subsection 1b of this definition has no reasonable potential for adversely affecting the potws operation or for violating any pretreatment standard or requirement the city may at any time on its own initiative or in response to a petition received from an industrial user or potw and in accordance with 40 cfr 4038f6 determine that such industrial user is not a significant industrial user slug means any discharge of water or wastewater which in concentration of any given constituent or in quantity of flow which adversely affects the collection system or performance of the wastewater facilities storm sewer means a sewer which carries stormwater surface water and drainage but excludes sanitary or polluted industrial wastewater superintendent means the water and wastewater superintendent or his authorized deputy agent or representative suspended solids means solids that either float on the surface of or are in suspension in wastewater or other liquids and which are removable by laboratory filtering total suspended solids tss means and is an acronym for all solids contained in sewage except colloidal and dissolved solids utilities director means the current utilities director of the city or his duly authorized representative wastewater means the spent water of a community from the standpoint of the source it may be a combination of the liquid and water borne wastes from residences commercial buildings industrial plants and institutions together with any groundwater surface water and stormwater that may be present the equivalent term is sewage watercourse means a natural or artificial channel for the passage of water either continuously or intermittently    use of public sewers required a all premises shall be provided by the owner thereof with at least one toilet all toilets shall be kept clean and in a sanitary working condition b no person shall dispose of human excrement except in a toilet c it shall be unlawful to discharge to any natural outlet within the city or in any area under the jurisdiction of the city any wastewater or other polluted waters including septic tank effluent or cesspool overflow to any open drain or wellpenetrating waterbearing formation except where suitable treatment has been provided in accordance with subsequent provisions of the division d except as hereinafter provided it shall be unlawful to construct or maintain any privy privy vault septic tank cesspool or other facility intended or used for the disposal of wastewater e the owners of all houses buildings or properties used for human occupancy employment recreation or other purposes situated within the citys jurisdiction and abutting on any street alley or rightofway in which there is now located or may in the future be located a public sanitary sewer of the city is hereby required at the owners expense to install suitable toilet facilities herein and to connect such facilities directly with the public sewer in accordance with the provisions of this division within 30 days after date of official notice to do so provided that said public sewer is within 100 feet of the property line f all sinks dishwashing machines lavatories basins shower baths bathtubs laundry tubs washing machines and similar plumbing fixtures or appliances shall be connected to the public sewer    private wastewater disposal a where a public sanitary sewer is not available under the provisions of section 90253 the building sewer shall be connected to a private wastewater disposal system complying with the provisions of the city and the state department of human resources b septic tanks shall be constructed repaired altered enlarged and maintained in accordance with the plans and specifications approved by the health officer septic tanks shall be maintained in sanitary working order c no person shall construct repair alter or enlarge any septic tank unless he shall hold a valid permit for such work issued by the health officer the health officer may withhold the issuance of such a permit pending the inspection and approval by the health officer of the site and location of the proposed work before any septic tank or any part thereof may be covered after it has been constructed repaired altered or enlarged it shall be inspected and approved by the health officer d the type capacities location and layout of a private wastewater disposal system shall comply with all recommendations of the state department of human resources no permit shall be issued for any private wastewater disposal system employing subsurface soil absorption facilities where the area of the lot is less than that allowed by the health officer no septic tank or cesspool shall be permitted to discharge to any natural outlet e no septic tank or other subsurface disposal facility shall be installed where a public sewer is accessible within 100 feet to the premises involved nor in any place where the health officer deems the use of same to be a menace to human health or wellbeing f at such time as a public sewer becomes available to a property served by a private wastewater disposal system a direct connection shall be made to the public sewer within 30 days after notice any septic tanks cesspools and similar private wastewater disposal facilities shall then be cleaned of sludge and filled with suitable material g the owner shall operate and maintain the private wastewater disposal facilities in a sanitary manner at all times at no expense to the city h flush toilets shall be provided at all times with sufficient running water under pressure to flush the toilet clean after each use i no pit privy shall be installed in the following locations 1 where a public sewer is accessible to the premises involved  2 in areas where the health officer deems the use of pit privies to constitute a nuisance or menace to the public health  3 where a pit privy may pollute any water supply  or 4 where the use of pit privies is not in keeping with the standard of sanitation in adjacent areas j any premises that has a septic tank privy or any other sewage industrial waste or liquid waste disposal system located thereon that does not function in a sanitary manner shall be corrected within 30 days from the receipt of written notification from the health officer k premises with private water systems shall not be connected with the public sewerage system l no statement contained in this division shall be construed to interfere with any additional requirements that may be imposed by the health officer    building sewers and connections a no unauthorized person shall uncover make any connections with or opening into use alter or disturb any public sewer or appurtenance thereof without first obtaining a written permit from the city b the owner or his agent shall make application on a special form furnished by the city the permit application shall be supplemented by any plans specifications or other information considered pertinent in the judgment of the utilities director a permit and inspection fee as specified in the fee schedule shall be paid at the time the application is filed c all costs and expenses incidental to the installation and connection of the building sewer shall be borne by the owner the owner shall indemnify the city for any loss or damage to the public sewer system that may directly or indirectly be occasioned by the installation of the building sewer d a separate and independent building sewer shall be provided for every property except where one building stands at the rear of another on an interior lot and no private sewer is available or can be constructed to the rear building adjoining alley court yard or driveway the front building may be extended to the rear building and the whole considered as one building sewer but the city does not and will not assume any obligation or responsibility for damage caused by or resulting from any such single connection aforementioned e old building sewers may be used in connection with new buildings only when they are found on examination and test by the utilities director to meet all requirements of this division f the size slope alignment materials of construction of building sewer and the method to be used in construction shall conform to the requirements of the building and plumbing code or other applicable rules and regulations of the city in the absence of code provisions or in amplification thereof the materials and procedures set forth in appropriate specifications of the american society for testing astm and water pollution control federation wpcf manual of practice no 9 shall apply g additionally the following materials and methods shall apply to building sewers within the city 1 the building sewer shall be cast iron soil pipe astm specification a74 latest revision or equal  ductile iron pipe american national standards institute ansi specification a2151 latest revision or equal  or polyvinyl chloride pvc sewer pipe astm specification d3034 latest revision all joints shall be tight and waterproof 2 any part of the building sewer that is located within ten feet of a water service pipe shall be constructed of cast iron soil pipe or ductile iron pipe with bolted mechanical joints if installed in filled or unstable ground the building sewer shall be of cast iron soil pipe except that plastic pipe may be acceptable if it is laid on a suitable concrete bed or cradle as approved by the utilities director 3 the size and slope of the building sewer shall be subject to the approval of the utilities director but in no event shall the diameter be less than four inches the slope of such fourinch pipe shall not be less than oneeighth inch per foot furthermore the appropriate requirements of the occupational health and safety act osha shall be followed 4 the depth shall be sufficient to afford protection from frost and the building sewer shall be laid at uniform grade and with straight alignment insofar as possible changes in direction shall be made only with properly curved pipe and fittings building sewers shall not be placed in the same trench with water service lines 5 an excavation required for the installation of a building sewer shall be open trench work unless otherwise approved by the utilities director pipelaying and backfilling shall be performed in accordance with astm specification c12 latest revision except that no backfill shall be placed until the work has been inspected and approved by the utilities director 6 all joints and connections shall be made gastight and watertight requirements are as follows a pushon joints for cast iron soil pipe shall have neoprene gaskets in accordance with the requirements of astm c564 b pushon joints for ductile iron pipe shall also have neoprene gaskets and be installed according to the manufacturers recommendations c pvc pipe joint material shall be of the bell and spigot type sealed with a rubber oring gasket having a composition and texture which is resistant to the common ingredients of sewage industrial wastes including oils and groundwater and which will endure permanently under the conditions likely to be imposed by this use installation of the gasket shall be done in accordance with the pipe manufacturers instructions using all the necessary materials lubricants and equipment recommended by the manufacturer d other jointing materials may be used only when approved by the utilities director h the connection of the building sewer into the public sewer shall be made at the y branch if such a branch is available at a suitable location if the public sewer is 12 inches in diameter or less and no properly located y branch is available the city shall at the owners expense cut a neat hole into the public sewer with entry in the downstream direction at an angle of about 45 degrees and install a 45degree elbow with the spigot end cut so as not to extend past the inner surface of the public sewer the invert of the building sewer at the point of connection shall be at an elevation of at least onetenth of a foot above the invert of the public sewer a neat smooth joint shall be made and the connection made secure and watertight by encasement in concrete special fittings may be used for the connection only when approved by the utilities director i whenever possible the building sewer shall be brought to the building at an elevation below the basement floor no building sewer shall be laid parallel to or within three feet of any bearing wall which might thereby be weakened in all buildings in which any building drain is too low to permit gravity flow to the public sewer sanitary sewage carried by such building drain shall be lifted by an approved means and discharged to the building sewer j no person shall make connection of roof downspouts foundation drains areaway drains or other sources of surface runoff or groundwater to a building sewer or a building drain which in turn is connected directly or indirectly to a public sanitary sewer unless such connection is approved for purposes of disposal of polluted surface drainage k the applicant for the building sewer permit shall notify the utilities director when the building sewer is ready for inspection and connection to the public sewer the connection and testing shall be made under the supervision of the utilities director or his representative l all excavations for building sewer installation shall be adequately guarded with barricades and lights so as to protect the public from hazard streets sidewalks parkways and other public property shall be restored in a manner satisfactory to the city m the city will define the availability of sewers and any costs associated with sewer permits or construction n the connection of the property sewer into the public sewer shall conform to the requirements of the building and plumbing code or other applicable rules and regulations of the city or the procedure set forth in appropriate specifications of the astm and the wpcf manual of practice no 9 all such connections shall be made gastight and watertight and verified by proper testing any deviation from the prescribed procedures and materials must be approved by the utilities director before installation o if any private sewer permits the entrance of infiltration or inflow to the public sewer the city may 1 require the owner to repair the private sewer  2 charge the owner a sewer rate that reflects the costs of the additional expense of sewage treatment from the owners property  or 3 require the owner to disconnect his sewer from the city sewer system    restricted use of public sewers  prohibitions a a user may not introduce into any public sewer any pollutants that cause passthrough or interference of the potw these general prohibitions and the specific prohibitions in subsection d of this section apply to each user introducing pollutants into the potw whether or not the user is subject to other national pretreatment standards or any national state or local pretreatment requirements b no person shall discharge or cause to be discharged any unpolluted waters such as stormwater groundwater roof runoff subsurface drainage cooling water or unpolluted industrial process waters to any sanitary sewer c stormwater and all other unpolluted drainage shall be discharged to such sewers as are specifically designated as combined sewers or storm sewers or to a natural outlet industrial cooling water or unpolluted process water may be discharged upon approval of the state environmental protection division to a storm sewer combined sewer or natural outlet d specific prohibitions except as herein provided no person shall discharge any of the following described waters or wastes into
